meanings.definition: To break down (a compound) by chemical reaction with water.
meanings.sent1: The scientist hydrolysed the sugar to study its components.
meanings.sent2: The enzymes in our body help hydrolyse the food we eat for digestion.
meanings.sent3: The water giggled as it hydrolysed the salt, making it disappear.
meanings.sent4: The raindrops seemed to hydrolyse the chalk drawings on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a simple experiment to show how water can hydrolyse paper.

meanings.sent1: The hydrolysed sugar solution tasted sweet and refreshing.
meanings.sent2: The hydrolysed proteins in the shampoo made my hair soft and shiny.
meanings.sent3: The hydrolysed paper airplane flew surprisingly well despite its wet condition.
meanings.sent4: The hydrolysed cotton fabric felt smooth and cool against her skin.
meanings.sent5: The hydrolysed plastic bottle crinkled easily under pressure, showing its weakness.
